   Prakobitz, Austria

   Peter Kinash - Farmer

   20

Kinash, Harry
Edam.
To Sask. - 1902

FORMER EXPERIENCE: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

PLEASE PRINT ALL PROPER NAMES AND PLACE NAMES IN CAPITAL LETTERS. IF YOU'RE NOT SURE THE NAME IS CORRECT AS YOU HAVE GIVEN IT, PLEASE SAY SO.

1. Your full name: Harry Kinash
2. Your address: Edam, Sask., Canada
3. Date: April 10, 1952
4. There were you born? (Give name of place and country) Poveshull, Manitoba
5. What was your father's name? Fred Kinash
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year) Spring 1902
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible. Nowhere

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child")
9. What were your reasons for coming here? For work, for opportunity
10. How did you learn about the West? Through other residents, hearing about it

Handwritten note:
"Place name: S. of Beverley, Canada"

Handwritten note from Fred Philip:
"Letters from Fred Philip"

Handwritten note:
"Red Aprils"
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

Too far to go - too far away
Some said they will follow

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

A few friends

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Boat - rail To Balcarres
Team from there

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement etc.).

All immigrants on overcrowded ships
The surplus & dear to turn back when passing thru N. Ontario. Was meeting of negro on train and how frightened I came everyone was.
The fear of Indians - but the Indians were friendly

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Fred Phillpott

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Between Balcarres & Melville - Phoenix Forks

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Saskatoon, Goodale, Raymond
Hubbard, Regina

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Odd jobs before - Homestead & rail work about 1905 (G.T.P.)
Over Melville
Worked for Phillpott
Finally worked in Can. Govt. Elevator for Office at which same Inspector (J. M. Anderson)
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

Too far to go - too far away

Some said they will follow

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, or other groups)?

With friends

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Train - Rail To Boreviches

14. What incidents of the journey west do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other exciting etc.)

Arriving in Canada & Time taken 20 hours

Meeting of people on train and how

Highlights of came everyone was

The first Indians - heard the Indians were

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Fred Redhead

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Bellevue Balcony or Melville - (Saskatchewan)

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Woodland, Brandon, Regina

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Worked in Billytown

Finally worked in Car Co. Plant to the age of

Women came together (J. M. Cameron)
12. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   About 4 times a year

13. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
   Married in 1903 in M. W. Smithfield's
   (Name of husband) Came from your old home (Ann Streych)

14. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation it as a place to settle?
   Yes

15. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.
   No relatives only friends who settled here - (Name of brother's old place)

16. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stand out in your memory which you would like to recount?
   Walking to Yorkton
   " " Balcarres and H. Couper
   Getting lost & how Indians took care to see Iroquois brought home
   A family to other places was a real undertaking all going together by oxen or on foot.

17. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
   Mostly on foot; sometimes by horse
   and later horse and buggy. We got together quite often. There was a way to churches still later. All pioneers used to gather at different places. Even have picnics or go which later inspection (J. T. M. Anderson wrote)
25. When was the first car used in the community? - around 1914

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?
   Ocean of 3 1/2 mile + Bismarck (not sure)
   Route or 20

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)
   Lots of peddlers in those days (jewish) mostly

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   Once every 2 weeks or sometimes once a week

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?
   Never in early days. We had Sunday together - we had no stores

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.
   Prior to before 1914 - about 1/5th
   It was mostly clothing we ordered
   Later on - you see peddlers supplied
   All - as well as nearby stores
   (near by means far by)

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?
   No phones

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   Never came as a child
   After getting married I had a large family so never cared to move much
   I've spent a few years in U.S.A.
   In a new place because it was too cold in winter

34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

Yes, to U.S.A. They would look over & say "hell" nothing here & away stuff to U.S.A. - especially those from Middle Class.

35. Did many people move away during the 1930's? Did many return?

For many. I lived in Saskatoon in the 30's.

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

I was a school trustee prior to 1914
& various other teachers
& also Doctor
& also Prof. U.O. Toronto

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combine, organizing the first lodge, etc.).

Started a church for my community
